text.p: Shares of gaming and leisure companies Magnum Corporation Bhd and Leisure Management Bhd were suspended on Tuesday, said an official at the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange.
Both companies' shares were suspended pending announcements by them, the official said.
Leisure Management is a 74 percent-owned subsidiary of Magnum and is its sole agent for the sale of four digit lottery numbers in Malaysia.
Magnum is also involved in the development of hotels and luxury condominiums in Kuala Lumpur.
Magnum shares closed on Monday at 5.25 ringgit, and Leisure Management closed at 9.60.
Officials at the two companies declined to comment on the reasons for the suspensions, but said that announcements would be made soon. They did not say when these would be made.
